conclusion: To solve the problem, the image will be analyzed to determine how liquid flows through the system, tracking its path through baffles and predicting which container it enters.
The image shows outlets labeled A, B, and C, through which liquid flows, passing through baffles and entering containers labeled D, E, and F. Baffles guide the flow of liquid.
The image contains outlets A, B, and C at the top, baffles in the middle, and containers D, E, F, and G at the bottom.
Liquid flows out from outlets A, B, and C and then passes through baffles, which direct the flow.
Liquid from outlet A flows through the first set of baffles.
Liquid from outlet B flows through baffles that direct it towards containers.
Liquid from outlet A goes to container D.
Liquid from outlet B goes to container E.
Liquid from outlet C goes to container F.
Each baffle set guides the liquid uniquely, and the liquid follows paths determined by baffle placements.
Containers D, E, and F receive liquid from outlets A, B, and C, respectively, as the liquid movement through baffles directs it to specific containers.
